snippet: In a speech, President Bashar al-Assad stressed that he would use an “an iron hand” against foreign enemies, even as many at home and abroad are predicting the fall of his government.
abstract: Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad continues to rely exclusively on repressive and violent security forces to stay in power, even as his isolation at home and abroad intensifies; analysts say Assad is following to the letter tactics he inherited from his father; Assad uses national address to blame 10-month uprising on 'outsiders' and 'terrorists,' pledging to continue to use an 'iron hand' in dealing with his country's enemies.

byline.contributor: Anthony Shadid contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon.
